Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • org.raspberrypi.cecil.view.Frame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, ViewInterface

    public class Frame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements ViewInterface
    View class for creating and displaying the main GUI and handling user inputs. MIT Open Source License
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Karishma Nune (kkn1g10), Cathy Jin (cj8g10) Southampton University, United Kingdom
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Frame

        public Frame(Controller controller)
        Creates the view with default fonts, colours, and values. A Controller object is passed in for callback handling.
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller where the Frame is created.

      • setAccStack

        public void setAccStack(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
        Description copied from interface: ViewInterface
        Set the values to be displayed in the accumulator register visualisation. Uses an ArrayList to show the history of values from oldest to newest.
        Specified by:
        setAccStack in interface ViewInterface
        Parameters:
        values - The values to be displayed.

      • setButtonsEnabled

        public void setButtonsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: ViewInterface
        Set the state of the run and step through buttons to be enabled or disabled. The buttons should be disabled until a successful compile has completed.
        Specified by:
        setButtonsEnabled in interface ViewInterface
        Parameters:
        enabled - The state to be displayed.

      • setIOEnabled

        public void setIOEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Description copied from interface: ViewInterface
        Set the state of the IO port checkbox to be enabled or disabled. The state should be disabled unless the application is running on a Raspberry Pi.
        Specified by:
        setIOEnabled in interface ViewInterface
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - The state to be displayed.
